 Spitzer Is Linked to Prostitution Ring 
 
 
 By DANNY HAKIM and WILLIAM K. RASHBAUM
 Published: March 10, 2008 
 
 
 
ALBANY - Gov. Eliot Spitzer, who gained national prominence relentlessly pursuing Wall Street wrongdoing, has been caught on a federal wiretap arranging to meet with a high-priced prostitute at a Washington hotel last month, according to a law enforcement official and a person briefed on the investigation.
 
 
 Mr. Spitzer, a first term Democrat, today made a brief public appearance during which he apologized for his behavior, and described it as a “private matter.” He did not address his political future.

Now that we've got their army starting to come back on line and we've got more of our soldiers there, the violence is calming and public opinion is swinging. The cause of the problems are the foreign fighters (who make up the majority of the 'insurgents'). The ongoing problems, like electricity and such are because the enemy keep blowing up the work we do. The Iraqis know that and have been rising up against them, which combined with the surge, is bringing the situation back into our favor!

But I would say the Pubs are a bit better on the 'morals' thing (ie. doing something about it), because the Dems do point the finger when a Pub does something.

 
 The Pubs only act when it is public knowledge. If they were indeed moral, they'd act when it was not public knowledge. It is really hard for me to accept them as the moral party when they have a long history of covering up moral scandals only to disown the parties in that scandal when the media releases news. If they were actually the moral party instead of whoring themselves for that vote, they'd do something before CNN got word of it. 
 
 
Also, I thought the Clinton thing was a bit blown out, but only for the BJ. He did lie (although, If I was married to Hill, I'd have lied tooemoticon_xgood ) I truly do believe though that he's been guilty of Sexual Harrassment (if not sexual assult) on some of the other ones.

 Because you don't understand what a commodity market is. This war isn't directly for oil. It is for the security and power projection over the Middle East and ensuring the stability of future oil. So really, it's for land. The reason oil is so high is because of the Bush's administration failure for proper post invasion planning, along with Chavez being a nutjob and Iran's nuclear desires. Now, if the US had an autarky economy and a nationalized oil company, we could do that.

is bringing the situation back into our favor!

 You're only partially right child. OPEC has cut back on production even though World usage is up so that based on supply and demand, the price is forced up, just as is happening. But my point stands that if the US was really in Iraq for OIL which is the claim I was responding to, then we could be loading 11,473,000+ gallons of oil in just one tanker and be transporting it home in tankers like this one all day, every day, assuring that our price per gallon remained low. I agree that protecting the flow of OIL is a true National security issue as oil is the lubricant that greases America's economic machine. So without it, we become another third World Country. Is that what you want?
 
 http://www.time.com/time/magazine/article/0,9171,824076,00.html?promoid=googlep

You're only partially right child. OPEC has cut back on production even though World usage is up so that based on supply and demand, the price is forced up, just as is happening.

 
 Yes and No. As I stated before, you don't understand what a commodity market is. Prices for commodities such as oil are set well before the product is actually traded. The price of oil is sky high due to the trading of futures. Futures prices are set somewhat by oil speculators. Oil speculators are getting spooked for a variety of reasons. OPEC's reduction has more to do with its declining capacity, fraudulently stated reserves and general failure to invest in its oil extraction industry then wanting to keep prices high. OPEC for several decades deliberately lowered prices to prevent what they feared was permanent damage to oil market, the key price at which true alternatives would arise and the monopoly OPEC so cherished would come crashing down.
 
 
But my point stands that if the US was really in Iraq for OIL which is the claim I was responding to, then we could be loading 11,473,000+ gallons of oil in just one tanker and be transporting it home in tankers like this one all day, every day, assuring that our price per gallon remained low.

 
 And your argument is stupid because it does not account for commodity markets, assumes the US has a nationalized oil company and the US economy is defined autarky
 
 
Is that what you want?

 
 Learn what a commodity market is before talking about oil.
 Some of the dumbest arguments about oil arise from peoples' ignorance of Commodity Markets.
